document.docTitle: Oryphantes aliquantulus Dupérré & Paquin, 2007, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Description of five new spiders from Canada (Araneae: Linyphiidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of five new spiders from Canada (Araneae: Linyphiidae)

Habitat. Forest litter, mainly conifers, and sphagnum.

Etymology. The epithet
aliquantulus
means little or small in latin and refers to the small size of the species for a linyphiine.
